00009 Parameters::Parameters( string StringID_ )
00010 {
00011   // Get ride of any whitespace around the given string
00012   boost::trim( StringID_ );
00013   StringID = StringID_;

00016 int Parameters::ParseInputFile( string FileName )
00017 {
00018   // First, we open up the file, check its existence
00019   ifstream FileIn;
00020   FileIn.open( FileName.c_str(), ios::in );  
00021   if ( FileIn.fail() )
00022   {
00023     cerr << "Parameters, unable to open file " << FileName << " for reading." << endl;
00024     return -20;
00025   }
00026 
00027   // Each line, we'll read into LineReadIn
00028   // Each line of settings will be counted in NumberOfLines
00029   string LineReadIn; long NumberOfLines = 0;
00030 
00031   // The string that identifies the beginning of the settings section
00032   string BeginString = "# Begin settings for " + StringID;
00033   // The string that identifies the end of the settings section
00034   string EndString = "# End setting for " + StringID;
00035 
00036   // Indicator whether we have found the settings section yet
00037   bool FoundStart = false;
00038   // Run through the file until we find the settings section
00039   do
00040   {
00041     if ( FileIn.eof() )
00042     {
00043       cerr << "Parameters, reached end of file at line before "; 
00044       cerr << "finding settings section: " << StringID << endl;
00045       return -21;
00046     }
00047     getline( FileIn, LineReadIn );
00048     boost::trim( LineReadIn );
00049     if ( LineReadIn == BeginString )
00050       FoundStart = true;
00051   }
00052   while ( !FoundStart );
00053 
00054   // Now we read each line, check whether it begins with a #, if not then we
00055   // pass it on to ParseSingleLine
00056   // When we parse each line, we will get a return value from the function ParseSingleLine
00057   int SingleLineReturnValue;
00058 
00059   while (! FileIn.eof() )
00060   {
00061     getline ( FileIn, LineReadIn );
00062     // First, trim the line of whitespace at each end
00063     boost::trim( LineReadIn );
00064 
00065     // If we've found the ending phrase, exit the while loop
00066     if ( LineReadIn == EndString )
00067       break;
00068 
00069     // If it's a blank line, or starts with a comment character #, skip this line
00070     if ( !(LineReadIn.size() == 0 || LineReadIn[0] == '#') )
00071     {
00072       SingleLineReturnValue = ParseSingleLine( LineReadIn );
00073       if ( SingleLineReturnValue != 0 )
00074       {
00075         // We've hit an error in the ParseSingleLine function
00076         FileIn.close();
00077         return SingleLineReturnValue;
00078       }
00079       ++NumberOfLines;
00080     }
00081   }
00082 
00083   // Now we're done, we close the file
00084   FileIn.close();
00085   // Everything has worked fine. Return a success code - the number of settings lines parsed
00086   return NumberOfLines;
00087 }
00088 
00089 int Parameters::ParseSingleLine( string LineString )
00090 {
00091   string ParamID;
00092   list<string> ParametersIn;
00093 
00094   // Use the boost library to split the string 'LineString' into sections, with
00095   // a space delimiter
00096   boost::split( ParametersIn, LineString, boost::is_any_of(" "));
00097 
00098   if ( ParametersIn.size() <= 1 )
00099   {
00100     // The length of a line must be at least a defining token and a parameter setting
00101     // value. If the length is <=1, then the format is wrong
00102     cerr << "Parameters, line length is too short: " << LineString << endl;
00103     return -3;
00104   }
00105 
00106   // The first element is the ParamID. Get it and then remove it from the Parameters list
00107   ParamID = ParametersIn.front();
00108   ParametersIn.pop_front();
00109 
00110   // First, we check whether we've already used this parameter
00111   map<string, list<string> >::iterator i = TheParameters.find( ParamID );
00112   if ( i != TheParameters.end() )
00113   {
00114     cerr << "Parameters, duplicate parameter read in: " << ParamID << endl;
00115     return -4;
00116   }
00117 
00118   // Now we have all the information to set up a 'parameter'
00119   // Put this into our map
00120   TheParameters.insert( pair<string,list<string> >( ParamID, ParametersIn ) );
00121   AccessedList.insert( pair<string,bool>( ParamID, false ) );
00122 
00123   // All is ok, return ok
00124   return 0;
00125 }
00126 
00127 list<string> Parameters::GetParametersString( string ParamID )
00128 {
00129   // We use the 'map' structure to turn the ParamID into a list of parameters
00130   map<string, list<string> >::iterator i = TheParameters.find( ParamID );
00131 
00132   // If we can't find the ParamID in the map, then we return an error code -1
00133   if ( i == TheParameters.end() )
00134   {
00135     list<string> EmptyList;
00136     std::cerr << "ParamParser, cannot find ParamID in the map: " << ParamID << std::endl;
00137     return EmptyList;
00138   }
00139 
00140   // We've found it. Set accessed to true (we don't mind multiple accesses)
00141   map<string, bool>::iterator j = AccessedList.find( ParamID );
00142   j->second = true;
00143 
00144   // Ok, we've found it, now we get the list<string> from the iterator i, and return it
00145   return (i->second);
00146 }

00148 vector<double> Parameters::GetParametersDouble( string ParamID )
00149 {
00150   list<string> StringList = GetParametersString( ParamID );
00151 
00152   vector<double> ReturnVector;
00153   double ConvertedString;
00154 
00155   for ( list<string>::iterator i = StringList.begin();
00156     i != StringList.end(); ++i )
00157   {
00158     ConvertedString = boost::lexical_cast<double>( *i );
00159     ReturnVector.push_back( ConvertedString );
00160   }
00161 
00162   // We've found it. Set accessed to true (we don't mind multiple accesses)
00163   map<string, bool>::iterator j = AccessedList.find( ParamID );
00164   j->second = true;
00165 
00166   return ReturnVector;
00167 }

00174   long ConvertedString;

00177     i != StringList.end(); ++i )
00178   {
00179     ConvertedString = boost::lexical_cast<long>( *i );
00180     ReturnVector.push_back( ConvertedString );
00181   }
00182 
00183   // We've found it. Set accessed to true (we don't mind multiple accesses)
00184   map<string, bool>::iterator j = AccessedList.find( ParamID );
00185   j->second = true;
00186 
00187   return ReturnVector;
00188 }

00190 int Parameters::CheckForUnaccessedParameters()
00191 {
00192   // How many unaccessed parameters have we found so far
00193   int ReturnValue = 0;
00194 
00195   // Now iterate over all parameters in the map
00196   // (the ParamIDs in AccessedList should be the same as in TheParameters)
00197   for ( map<string, bool>::iterator i = AccessedList.begin();
00198         i != AccessedList.end(); ++i )
00199   {
00200     if ( i->second != true )
00201     {
00202       ++ReturnValue;
00203       cerr << "Unused parameter: " << i->first << "\n";
00204     }
00205   }
00206 
00207   return ReturnValue;
00208 }

00210 int Parameters::WriteToFile( string FileName, bool Append )
00211 {
00212   // First, open the file
00213   std::ofstream FileOut;
00214   if ( Append )
00215   {
00216     FileOut.open( FileName.c_str(), ios::app );
00217   }
00218   else
00219   {
00220     FileOut.open( FileName.c_str(), ios::trunc );
00221   }
00222   
00223   // Check for errors
00224   if ( FileOut.fail() )
00225   {
00226     cerr << "Parameters, unable to open file " << FileName << " for reading." << endl;
00227     return -20;
00228   }
00229 
00230   // First, write out our ID string
00231   FileOut << "# Begin settings for " << StringID << "\n";
00232 
00233   // Now, go through the map and write out all the settings!
00234   map<string, list<string> >::const_iterator i;
00235   list<string>::const_iterator j;
00236   for ( i = TheParameters.begin(); i != TheParameters.end(); ++i )
00237   {
00238     // First, we have the ParamID string
00239     FileOut << i->first << " ";
00240     // Now we go through each setting in the list
00241     for ( j = (i->second).begin(); j != (i->second).end(); ++j )
00242     {
00243       FileOut << *j << " ";
00244     }
00245     FileOut << "\n";
00246   }
00247 
00248   // Now, write out our ending ID string
00249   FileOut << "# End settings for " << StringID << "\n";
00250 
00251   // We're done
00252   FileOut.close();
00253 
00254   return 0;
00255 }
